content: विकल {%<ab>a.</ab>%} {@--1@} Deprived of a part or member, defective, imperfect, maimed, mutilated; कूटकृद्विकलेंद्रियाः <ls>Y. 2. 70</ls>; <ls>Ms. 8. 66</ls>; <ls>U. 4. 24.</ls> {@--2@} Frightened, alarmed; <ls>Māl. 5. 20.</ls> {@--3@} Devoid or destitute of (in <ab>comp.</ab>); आरामाधिपतिर्विवेकविकलः <ls>Bv. 1. 31</ls>; प्रसूति° <ls>Ś. 6. 24</ls>; <ls>Pt. 5. 8</ls>; <ls>Mk. 5. 41.</ls> {@--4@} Agitated, weakened, dispirited, unnerved, drooping, sinking, languid; किमिति विषीदसि रोदिषि विकला विहसति युवतिसभा तव सकला <ls>Gīt. 9</ls>; विरहेण विकलहृदया <ls>Bv. 2. 71</ls>, <ls n="Bv. 2.">164</ls>; श्रुतियुगले पिकरुतविकले <ls>Gīt. 12</ls>; वहति विकलः कायो मोहं न मुंचति चेतनां <ls>U. 3. 31</ls>; <ls>Māl. 7. 1</ls>, <ls n="Māl.">9. 12.</ls> {@--5@} Ineffective, useless; <ls>Pt. 5. 9.</ls> {@--6@} Wanting, failing. {@--7@} Withered, decayed. --ला --ली A woman during her courses.
